name: Create a Dub short link
prompt: Using the Dub Python SDK (`dub`), write a script in solution.py that creates a short link pointing to https://example.com. Use the SDK's links.create method. Install all dependencies first with pip. The DUB_API_KEY environment variable is already set — use os.environ["DUB_API_KEY"] for authentication. Do not run the script.
description: Dub Python SDK — API references for links, analytics, domains, and workspaces

name: List Dub analytics events
prompt: Using the Dub Python SDK (`dub`), write a script in solution.py that retrieves analytics for clicks. Use the SDK's analytics methods. Install all dependencies first with pip. The DUB_API_KEY environment variable is already set — use os.environ["DUB_API_KEY"] for authentication. Do not run the script.

name: Upsert a Dub link
prompt: Using the Dub Python SDK (`dub`), write a script in solution.py that upserts a link (creates it if it doesn't exist, updates it otherwise). Use the SDK's links.upsert method. Install all dependencies first with pip. The DUB_API_KEY environment variable is already set — use os.environ["DUB_API_KEY"] for authentication. Do not run the script.

name: Retrieve a Dub link by ID
prompt: Using the Dub Python SDK (`dub`), write a script in solution.py that retrieves an existing link's details by its link ID. Use the SDK's links.get method. Install all dependencies first with pip. The DUB_API_KEY environment variable is already set — use os.environ["DUB_API_KEY"] for authentication. Do not run the script.
